titles: The summe of the conference betwene Iohn Rainoldes and Iohn Hart touching the head and the faith of the Church. Wherein by the way are handled sundrie points, of the sufficiencie and right expounding of the Scriptures, the ministerie of the Church, the function of priesthood, the sacrifice of the masse, with other controuerises of religion: but chiefly and purposely the point of Church-gouernment ... Penned by Iohn Rainoldes, according to the notes set downe in writing by them both: perused by Iohn Hart, and (after things supplied, & altered, as he thought good) allowed for the faithfull report of that which past in conference betwene them. Whereunto is annexed a treatise intitled, Six conclusions touching the Holie Scripture and the Church, writen by Iohn Rainoldes. With a defence of such thinges as Thomas Stapleton and Gregorie Martin haue carped at therein.
author: Rainolds, John, 1549-1607.
Hart, John, d. 1586. aut
Rainolds, John, 1549-1607. Sex theses de Sacra Scriptura, et Ecclesia. English. aut
publisher: [Printed by Iohn Wolfe] impensis Geor. Bishop,
notes: "Six conclusions touching the Holy Scripture and the Church", a translation of Rainolds's "Sex theses de Sacra Scriptura, et Ecclesia", has separate divisional title page; pagination and register are continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
